meanings.definition: To make or repair (something) clumsily or hastily
meanings.sent1: He tried to bodge the broken chair back together.
meanings.sent2: She always bodge her school projects at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The student attempted to bodge a robot out of cardboard and tape.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to bodge together a meal with limited ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to bodge a temporary fix to get the car running again.

meanings.sent1: The bodge on the leaky pipe didn't hold for long.
meanings.sent2: He made a quick bodge to stop the door from squeaking.
meanings.sent3: The bodge on the fence made it look like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent4: The bodge on the roof was just a band-aid solution.
meanings.sent5: The bodge on the broken toy made it barely functional.

meanings.definition: A clumsy or inept piece of work
meanings.sent1: The painting was a bodge of colors that didn't blend well.
meanings.sent2: Her attempt at baking was a complete bodge.
meanings.sent3: The play was a hilarious bodge of forgotten lines and missed cues.
meanings.sent4: The report was a bodge of copied paragraphs from different sources.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture looked like a bodge of clay thrown together in a rush.
